So I did some quick research on what makes the best oil for ferrofluid and apparently oleic acid is a surfactant found in mono unsaturated fats which olive oil is high in, but almond oil has a similar oleic acid content but lower viscosity. A science fair summary paper had found grapeseed oil to be another option as well. The oleic acid acts as a surfactant by having both polar and nonpolar sides of the molecule.

In small or medium sized washes by where I live there are these black streaks of "sand" (actually magnetite), and if you put a magnet in a plastic bag it picks up TONS of it, and then you don't have to worry about drying it because its already dry from being in the sand. With the plastic bag method you can also easily get rid of the dirt/sand by putting the magnet in a plastic bag, collecting the magnetite, and then inverting the plastic bag to remove the magnet and make the magnetite loose again, repeat a few times and it gets quite pure. I have a few full bowls of it still because collecting it is really fun in my opinion.
